job_description:
Adform focuses on an exploration of a vast amount of online advertising data, development of predictive and segmentation models to optimize campaign strategy towards the most meaningful inventory, audience and ad, fraud detection, and many others. You will be a vital part of the data scientist efforts, working in a cross-functional international Agile team, with other data scientists, engineers, product managers, and leaders located in multiple locations around the world. If you are hands-on passionate, crazy about a development of advanced algorithms, machine learning, statistics, Hadoop, Python and SQL, have an ownership mindset, love to work in teams with smart, informal and open people, we’d love to get to know you! 

Our focus is Big Data, High Load and challenging experiences with understanding and taking advantage from data in Ad-Tech industry.
 


We hope you are ready to change the game! Be ready to:

Apply advanced machine learning/statistical algorithms scalable to huge data sets to: 
Determine the most meaningful ad, served to the right user at the optimal time, and the best price 
Identify behaviours, interests and segments of web users across billions of transactions to find the most optimal audience for a given advertising activity 
Eliminate suspicious / non-human traffic 
Maintenance our products, support customers in analysing the reasons behind the decisions made by our algorithms and look for new improvements in the process of striving for their excellence 
Work closely with other Data Scientists, development, and product teams to implement algorithms into production-level software. Mentor less experienced colleagues. 
Contribute to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions 
Be an active technical challenger in the team for the purpose of mutual improvement and broadening of team and company horizons 
Design solutions and lead cross-functional technical projects from ideation to deployment 


Attitude First. Everything else will follow. We can grow together faster if you have:

Minimum 1 year work experience in a similar senior position. Minimum 6 years experience in Data Science in total. 
Masters or PhD in a quantitative field such as Machine Learning, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics or related. 
Excellent mathematical and statistical skills (statistical inference), experience in working with large datasets. Knowledge of data pipelines, ETL processes. 
Very good knowledge of multiply supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques with math background and hands-on experience 
Great problem-solving and analytical skills. 
Ability to structure a large business problem into tractable and reasonable components, design and deploy scalable machine learning solutions 
Proficiency in Python, SQL 
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hadoop)
Adform‘s guiding principles ingrained in your profile: Focus on Client Value, Behave with Decency, Take Ownership, Care, Collaborateas a TeamPlayer, Remain Ambitious, and StandTall inall interactions 


Stand out by having:

Knowledge of Ad Tech industry solutions 
Knowledge of web technologies 


Our promise to you:

You will be a vital part of the data scientist efforts, working in a cross-functional international Agile team, with other data scientists, engineers, product managers, and leaders located in multiple locations around the world. 
A dynamic, inspiring, and international environment filled with ambitious and caring colleagues
Premium health insurance with ₹10,00,000 coverage for you and your family
24 paid vacation days to enjoy life outside of work
Paid maternity (6 months) and paternity (2 weeks)
Annual learning budget to help you grow your skills and support continuous learning
Rewarding referral program for helping us grow
Global perks such as birthday gifts, work anniversaries, and company events to connect with colleagues and have fun
And much more – join us to explore the full experience


Diversity s Inclusion @Adform:

Adform is an equal opportunity employer with a global perspective. We remain committed to creating an environment that not only respects different backgrounds but celebrates them too. We believe that diversity in all its forms enhances our teams’ creativity, innovation, and effectiveness, and therefore we value different backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.
We are committed to creating a work environment where Adform employees feel valued for who they are and what they can contribute, free from any type of discrimination.

profile_data.headline: Jr. Machine Learning Engineer
profile_data.about:
Welcome to my world of AI-driven innovation and creativity!

As a Computer Science and Engineering graduate with a passion for Artificial Intelligence since 2017, I bring a fresh perspective to the dynamic world of technology. My journey began with a fascination for AI's potential to transform the way we interact with machines, and it quickly led me to specialize in Natural Language Processing and Generative AI.

Being a firm believer that communication is the key to success, I pride myself on my exceptional English communication skills, enabling me to bridge the gap between complex AI concepts and everyday conversations. I find joy in breaking down intricate technical jargon into accessible knowledge for everyone.

The ever-evolving landscape of artificial intelligence captivates me, and I am determined to be an active participant in its unfolding story. Staying up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI is not just a habit; it's a passion that drives me to explore, experiment, and share my insights with the world.

Driven by a relentless pursuit of excellence, I approach every project with a result-oriented mindset. The thirst for knowledge and a hunger to learn new things quickly propels me forward, fueling my desire to make a meaningful impact in the AI domain.

When it comes to turning ideas into reality, I wield the power of Python programming and leverage data science libraries to create AI solutions that go beyond the ordinary. My technical proficiency and problem-solving skills empower me to take on challenges with confidence and innovation.

With boundless curiosity and a commitment to excellence, I am eager to forge ahead in the realm of Artificial Intelligence, making significant contributions that shape the future. Join me on this exciting journey as we push the boundaries of what AI can achieve and unlock the full potential of this remarkable technology together.

Let's embark on a transformative AI adventure – one where creativity, dedication, and limitless possibilities converge. Together, we will shape the future of AI and create a world where intelligent machines revolutionize our lives for the better.

description.text:
Immersed in cutting-edge technologies, I gained substantial knowledge and practical experience in generative AI, system design, and integration of complex APIs. Enhanced my technical prowess using Docker and AWS to develop scalable solutions in a dynamic start-up environment.

Spearheaded the development of an innovative application designed to optimize resumes for ATS compatibility. This tool automatically analyzes resumes, identifies deficiencies, queries users to fill gaps, and reformats the information into an enhanced, ATS-friendly format, significantly boosting job seekers' chances of landing interviews.

Created a smart, adaptive question-answering system tailored for major standardized tests including IELTS, TOEFL, GMAT, and GRE. The system evaluates user responses, pinpoints errors, and generates personalized reports offering detailed insights and strategies for improving both topic-specific skills and overall exam performance.

• Engaged in an intensive training program focusing on Java and SQL, gaining foundational knowledge and expertise in both areas.
• Successfully completed monthly milestone tests with 82 %, demonstrating consistent growth and understanding of key concepts.
• Collaborated with a diverse team of interns, sharing insights and learning from collective experiences
• Demonstrated commitment and adaptability by quickly adjusting to the dynamic learning environment and meeting all set milestones.
Abdul R  IGNITE Training Completion Certificate.pdf

Drips Monitoring Stress Detection System for Patients

• Seamlessly integrated an EDA sensor with NodeMCU to gauge patient stress levels in real-time.
• Achieved continuous data updates to ThingSpeak cloud, ensuring immediate access and monitoring capabilities for medical professionals.

keywords:
Given the user's "hi" input, I cannot provide a specific keyword-related response without further information about their needs.  To help, please clarify:

1. Do you want me to extract keywords from the provided job description?
2. Or, do you want me to compare the job description's keywords against your LinkedIn profile and identify missing keywords?

messages.ai_response: Hello! How can I assist you with optimizing your LinkedIn profile today?

messages.user_query: Improve my profile so I can apply for Data Scientist role
messages.ai_response:
To optimize your LinkedIn profile for Data Scientist roles, focus on these key areas:

1. **Headline:**  Instead of "Jr. Machine Learning Engineer," use a keyword-rich headline highlighting your data science skills and aspirations.  Examples: "Data Scientist | Machine Learning Engineer | NLP Expertise" or "Aspiring Data Scientist | Building AI Solutions | Python, NLP".

2. **Experience Section:** Quantify your achievements.  Instead of describing tasks, focus on the impact of your work. For example,  "Developed an ATS-compatible resume optimizer, resulting in a X% increase in interview rates for job seekers" is stronger than "Developed an application to optimize resumes for ATS compatibility."  Use action verbs and numbers to showcase your contributions.  Also, consolidate your experience at Careerninja/LearnTube into a single entry, chronologically listing your roles (Intern then Engineer).

3. **Skills Section:** Reorder your skills to prioritize those most relevant to Data Scientist roles (e.g., Python, SQL, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Data Analysis, Data Visualization). Add skills like statistical modeling, data mining, and any specific libraries you're proficient in (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).  Remove less relevant skills like "Communication" from this section; it's better suited for the About section.

4. **About Section:** While well-written, it lacks quantifiable achievements.  Weave in numbers reflecting your accomplishments from your projects and experiences. Briefly mention specific projects, highlighting the technologies used and the positive impact you made.  For instance, mention the percentage improvement in the Drips Monitoring system or the specific accuracy achieved by your Sentence Similarity Analyzer.


By focusing on these four areas, you will significantly strengthen your LinkedIn profile's appeal to recruiters and hiring managers seeking Data Scientists.

This project showcased skills in data analysis, IoT application development, and real-time data processing.  Successfully collaborated on weekly team projects, contributing significantly to the coding and programming aspects.

messages.user_query: I wanna becom a data scientist suggest me stuff based on my role
messages.ai_response:
To transition from your current role as a Junior Machine Learning Engineer at LearnTube.ai to a Data Scientist, particularly targeting roles like those at Adform, we've identified key skill gaps and developed a structured learning roadmap.  This plan prioritizes high-impact learning and project experience to compensate for your current experience level.

**Critical Skill Gaps & Learning Pathway:**

* **Big Data Technologies (Hadoop, Spark):** Gain practical experience with Hadoop and Spark through projects using large datasets (e.g., Kaggle).  Consider DataCamp's "Apache Spark and Scala" course (20 hours, Intermediate).

* **Advanced Machine Learning Algorithms & Statistical Inference:** Deepen your understanding of advanced algorithms (time series analysis, deep learning for AdTech applications like click-through prediction) and strengthen your statistical inference skills (hypothesis testing, model evaluation). Coursera's "Machine Learning Specialization" (Andrew Ng) is a good starting point (3 months, Intermediate/Advanced). Supplement with specialized AdTech courses.

* **ETL Processes and Data Pipelines:** Learn common ETL tools (Apache Kafka, Airflow) and build a portfolio project demonstrating your ability to design and implement efficient data pipelines. A Udemy course on Apache Kafka is recommended (10-20 hours, Beginner/Intermediate). Use a cloud platform (AWS, GCP, Azure) for your project.

* **SQL for Big Data:** Practice writing optimized SQL queries for large datasets, focusing on window functions and CTEs.  Mode Analytics (or a similar resource) offers advanced SQL courses (2 weeks, Intermediate).

* **Ad Tech Domain Knowledge:** Read industry blogs, articles, and white papers. Network with AdTech professionals and attend relevant conferences or webinars.

**Personalized Roadmap:**

This roadmap is divided into three phases, each with specific skills to acquire, projects to complete, and success metrics to achieve.

**Phase 1 (Months 1-3): Foundation Building**

* **Advanced Statistical Modeling:**  Study "Statistical Learning" (Hastie, Tibshirani, Friedman) and supplement with online courses on Coursera or edX (hypothesis testing, regression, model evaluation).
* **Big Data Technologies (Hadoop & Spark):**  Read "Apache Spark: The Definitive Guide" and take a hands-on course.
* **Project:** Develop a data pipeline using Hadoop and Spark to process a large public dataset, perform EDA, and build a predictive model.  Document thoroughly.

**Phase 2 (Months 4-6): Intermediate Development**

* **Advanced Machine Learning Techniques:**  Take a comprehensive course on advanced ML algorithms (deep learning, time series analysis, reinforcement learning).
* **AdTech Fundamentals:** Take online courses or workshops on AdTech fundamentals, programmatic advertising, RTB, and ad fraud detection. Explore relevant industry blogs and communities.
* **Project:** Expand the Phase 1 project by incorporating more advanced ML techniques and deploying the model using a cloud platform.  Create a detailed technical report and GitHub repository.

**Phase 3 (Months 7-12): Advanced Preparation**

* **Scalable Machine Learning Deployment (MLOps):** Focus on MLOps principles and best practices. Explore relevant resources and consider AWS Certified Machine Learning – Specialty certification.
* **Industry-specific knowledge:** Actively engage with AdTech communities, read relevant blogs, and network with professionals.
* **Project:** Apply for Data Scientist roles at Adform and similar companies.

**Addressing the Experience Gap:**  The significant experience gap requires a strategic approach. This roadmap focuses on rapidly building expertise through intensive learning and high-impact projects.  Highlight quantifiable achievements and transferable skills on your LinkedIn profile, and actively network to compensate for the lack of direct senior experience. Consider smaller projects or consulting opportunities to gain further practical AdTech experience.  MLOps and cloud computing (AWS, GCP, Azure) expertise are significant competitive advantages to highlight.

messages.user_query: just list them please so I can find or do courses
messages.ai_response:
**Critical Skills to Learn:**

* **Advanced Machine Learning Algorithms:**  Focus on techniques scalable to massive datasets.  Consider courses covering deep learning, ensemble methods, and model optimization for large-scale applications.
* **Big Data Technologies (Hadoop, Spark):** Gain practical experience with distributed data processing frameworks.
* **ETL Processes and Data Pipelines:** Master the design and implementation of robust data pipelines for handling and transforming large datasets.


**Course Recommendations:**

* **Advanced Machine Learning Specialization (Coursera):** Andrew Ng, ~3 months, Intermediate/Advanced.  Focus on relevant sections for large-scale applications.
* **Apache Spark and Scala (DataCamp):**  Various instructors, ~20 hours, Intermediate. Hands-on practice with Spark.
* **Data Engineering with Apache Spark (Udemy):**  Various instructors, duration varies, Intermediate/Advanced.  Focus on ETL processes within Spark.
* **Building Data Pipelines on AWS (Udemy/Coursera):** Duration varies, Intermediate/Advanced.  Choose a course that aligns with your preferred cloud platform (AWS is mentioned in your experience).


**Competitive Advantages:**

* **Ad Tech Industry Knowledge:** Explore online resources and industry publications to gain familiarity with ad tech concepts, terminology, and common challenges.
* **Experience with Fraud Detection Algorithms:** Look for specialized courses or research papers focusing on fraud detection in online advertising.

Note:  This list prioritizes the most critical gaps for transitioning to a Data Scientist role at Adform, based on the job description.  The duration estimates are approximate and may vary depending on the specific course and your learning pace.  Supplement these courses with hands-on projects to build a strong portfolio.

Becoming a CTO requires a significant career transition from your current position as a Junior Machine Learning Engineer.  The path is ambitious and will take several years, but this roadmap outlines the crucial first steps.

**Phase 1: Building a Strong Technical Foundation (Months 1-3)**

* **Advanced Machine Learning Algorithms:** Complete the "Advanced Machine Learning Specialization" on Coursera (Deeplearning.AI). (3 months)
* **Big Data Technologies (Hadoop & Spark):** Complete a "Big Data Specialization" on Coursera or a comparable Udemy course with hands-on projects. (3 months)
* **Project:** Develop a small-scale AdTech project using publicly available data (e.g., Kaggle). Focus on a problem like click-through rate prediction, demonstrating data preprocessing, feature engineering, model building, and evaluation.  Document on GitHub.

**Phase 2: Expanding Technical and Leadership Skills (Months 4-6)**

* **ETL Processes and Data Pipelines:** Complete a course on Data Warehousing and ETL (e.g., "Data Warehousing and ETL with Informatica" on Udemy). (2 months)
* **Leadership and Project Management:** Complete a course on project management, focusing on Agile methodologies. (1 month)
* **Project:** Expand your AdTech project to incorporate ETL processes, improve model scalability, and add a more sophisticated data pipeline. Document extensively.

**Phase 3:  Advancing into AdTech and Leadership (Months 7-12)**

* **Deep Dive into AdTech:**  Combine online courses on programmatic advertising, ad serving technologies, and ad fraud detection with participation in relevant online communities (e.g., r/adtech) and industry blogs. (6 months)
* **Industry Knowledge:** Focus on AdTech challenges and solutions through research papers, industry publications, and networking. Consider relevant certifications (e.g., Google AdWords).
* **Job Applications:** After 9 months, begin applying for senior data scientist roles in AdTech, targeting roles with increasing leadership responsibilities.


**Critical Skill Gaps Requiring Long-Term Development:**

* **Strategic Leadership & Management:**  Gain experience leading technical teams, developing technology roadmaps, and making high-level business decisions.  Consider an executive education program from a reputable business school.
* **Software Architecture & System Design:** Develop a deep understanding of designing, building, and scaling complex software systems. Take online courses on system design and architecture.
* **Business Acumen & Financial Management:**  Understand business strategy, financial modeling, budgeting, and P&L management. Take online courses in these areas.
* **Communication & Stakeholder Management:** Improve communication skills through public speaking and executive coaching.
* **Cloud Computing & Infrastructure Management:** Deepen your understanding of cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP), DevOps, security, and cost optimization.


This roadmap prioritizes gaining experience through progressively complex projects and targeting senior roles.  Pursuing a Master's or PhD would significantly enhance long-term prospects.  Remember, becoming a CTO is a long-term goal requiring sustained effort and development across technical and leadership domains.
